books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel set in the 1920s about the American dream, wealth, and love.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel that explores totalitarianism and surveillance.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about racial injustice and childhood innocence.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic novel that explores themes of love, marriage, and social class.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: The epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt the elusive white whale.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story about teenage alienation and the search for identity.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins in Middle-earth.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd's journey to find his personal legend.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A dystopian novel that explores a future society of advanced technology and conformity.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A psychological drama about a young man who commits a crime and wrestles with guilt.
